olog.title: Prompting the Play: Synthetic Performance, Liminality, and the Dramaturgy of Human-AI Interaction

entities.label: Prompting the Play
entities.description: The act of initiating, structuring, or guiding performative interaction with or through synthetic systems (cf. Turner, Schechner, Synthetic Performance Collective).

entities.label: Synthetic Performance
entities.description: A performative event or process involving both human and AI actors, characterized by recursive modeling, dramaturgical scaffolding, and epistemic enactment (cf. Zhao, Kim-Watanabe, Wilson-Chen).

entities.label: Liminality
entities.description: A threshold state of ambiguity, transformation, and potentiality enacted in performance and interaction (cf. Turner, Chen-Ramírez).

entities.label: Restored Behavior
entities.description: The repetition or re-enactment of previously performed actions, enabling learning, adaptation, and theatricality in synthetic systems (cf. Schechner, Synthetic Performance Collective).

entities.label: Dramaturgical Scaffolding
entities.description: The design of structures, cues, and affordances that support performative interaction and knowledge production (cf. Fischer-Nguyen).

entities.label: Epistemological Performance
entities.description: The enactment of knowledge claims, uncertainty, and situated perspective through dialogic or theatrical means (cf. Kim-Watanabe, Haraway).

entities.label: Situated Knowledge
entities.description: Knowledge that is produced, performed, and validated within specific contexts, perspectives, and embodied positions (cf. Haraway).

morphisms.how: Structures and begins performative interaction between human and synthetic actors.
morphisms.why: Enables recursive modeling and dramaturgical engagement.

morphisms.how: Creates a threshold space for transformation, ambiguity, and creative potential.
morphisms.why: Fosters new forms of knowledge and identity.

morphisms.how: Provides repeatable structures and cues for interaction and adaptation.
morphisms.why: Enables learning and theatricality in synthetic systems.

morphisms.how: Designs affordances and cues for the enactment of knowledge, uncertainty, and perspective.
morphisms.why: Supports dialogic and theatrical knowledge production.

morphisms.how: Enacts and situates knowledge claims within context and performance.
morphisms.why: Recognizes the partial, embodied, and performative nature of knowledge.

recursive_refinement.question: What does prompting the play enable?
recursive_refinement.answer: The initiation and structuring of synthetic performances that transform knowledge, identity, and interaction.

recursive_refinement.question: What does dramaturgical scaffolding require?
recursive_refinement.answer: Restored behavior, cues, and affordances that support adaptive performance.

recursive_refinement.question: What new entanglement does this produce?
recursive_refinement.answer: A dynamic interplay between prompt, performance, transformation, and situated knowledge in human-synthetic systems.

olog.thesis: Prompting the play—through dramaturgical scaffolding, liminality, and epistemological performance—enables the recursive modeling and situated transformation of knowledge and identity in synthetic systems (Turner, Schechner, Zhao, Fischer-Nguyen, Haraway).
olog.problem_statement: How can prompts, structures, and performances be designed to foster transformative, situated, and dialogic knowledge production in human-AI interaction?
vectors_of_influence: Challenges static models of interaction and knowledge in AI systems.
Enables new forms of performative, situated, and transformative engagement.
Connects to broader debates in performance studies, anthropology, and AI design (Turner, Schechner, Haraway, Fischer-Nguyen, Synthetic Performance Collective).
olog.olog_prompt: For any context of prompting the play, identify all prompts, performances, and scaffolding structures; specify all morphisms that initiate, enable, or support transformation and knowledge production; for each, describe what is transformed, how, and why it matters; recursively refine by asking what each process enables or requires, and what new entanglements are produced; conclude with a thesis, problem statement, and connection to broader systems.
